summary: Clean, responsive academic frontend prototype website for “Online Food Ordering System” using a strict step-by-step flow (only one step visible at a time): Restaurant/Menu → Cart → Delivery Details → Order Tracking, plus About Project and Footer (no payment; backend/database conceptual; smooth navigation and clear progress).
architectural_notes: Frontend-only implementation (UI only for login/registration). Backend/database are conceptual (e.g., Firebase) for academic demonstration.
Site should be responsive with a clean, simple, professional presentation suitable for a college mini project.
Add clickable dish images in the Customer Portal menu; clicking opens a modal popup with a larger image (can use placeholder/sample images).
Use a strict step-by-step UI flow where only one step/page is visible at a time: Menu → Cart → Delivery Details → Tracking, with smooth navigation and clear progress.
Menu step must not display cart/details/tracking; Cart step must not display menu/details/tracking; Details step must not display menu/cart; Tracking step must show only the current status clearly.
known_issues: Order tracking/status tracker does not update correctly after placing an order; needs correction so tracking displays the correct states after order submission.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Realistic photo of a pizza on a plate (pizza.dim_800x600.png)
- Realistic photo of a burger on a plate (burger.dim_800x600.png)
- Realistic photo of biryani in a bowl (biryani.dim_800x600.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive Home page for the website titled “Online Food Ordering System” that includes: (1) the main title “Online Food Ordering System”, (2) subtitle “Order your favorite food anytime, anywhere”, (3) a short description explaining the platform connects customers, restaurants, and delivery partners, and (4) three prominent CTA buttons linking/navigating to: Customer Portal, Restaurant Portal, and Delivery Partner Portal.

Implement a Customer Portal section/page containing: (1) Customer Login / Registration UI (UI only; no real authentication), (2) a Restaurant Listing with sample restaurants, (3) a Food Menu with sample items and prices: Pizza – ₹199, Burger – ₹129, Biryani – ₹249, each with an “Order Now” button, (4) an Order Form with fields Name, Phone Number, Food Item, Quantity, Delivery Address, and (5) an Order Status tracker showing the states: Received → Preparing → Out for Delivery → Delivered.

Implement a Restaurant Portal section/page containing: (1) Restaurant Login UI (UI only; no real authentication), (2) a dashboard area that shows “New Orders” and “Accepted Orders”, (3) a sample order list showing order ID, food item, and status, (4) “Accept Order” and “Reject Order” buttons for sample orders, and (5) a Menu Management section listing food items and prices.

Implement a Delivery Partner Portal section/page containing: (1) Delivery Partner Login UI (UI only; no real authentication), (2) an Assigned Orders section listing sample assigned orders with Order ID, Pickup Restaurant, and Delivery Address, and (3) “Picked Up” and “Delivered” buttons for assigned orders.

Add an “About Project” section/page with the exact concept described: it is a frontend implementation developed using a no-code website builder, demonstrating workflow between customers, restaurants, and delivery partners, and that backend/database operations are explained conceptually.
Add a “Technologies Used” section/page that lists exactly: Frontend: No-code website builder; Backend: Conceptual (Firebase); Database: Conceptual.
Add a Footer to the site that includes: “College Mini Project”, “Online Food Ordering System”, and “Thank You”.

Apply a consistent, clean, simple, professional visual theme suitable for academic presentation across all pages/sections, including typography, spacing, and a cohesive color palette (avoid blue/purple). Ensure mobile-first responsiveness for key layouts (home CTAs, portal dashboards/lists, and forms).
Add real dish images (static assets) for each sample menu item in the Customer Portal menu (Pizza, Burger, Biryani, Pasta, Sandwich, Noodles), replacing the current emoji-only presentation.

Make each dish image in the Customer Portal menu clickable so that clicking the image opens a modal/popup showing a larger version of that dish image (option 1). The modal must be dismissible and must not break the existing "Order Now" button behavior.

Update the Customer Portal menu data model in frontend/src/pages/CustomerPortal.tsx so each menu item references its corresponding static image filename, and wire the UI to use those image files with appropriate alt text in English.

Correct the Customer Portal order tracking flow so that after an order is placed, the tracking UI reflects the correct sequence of states (Received → Preparing → Out for Delivery → Delivered) for the most recently placed order, without being affected by previous submissions.

Update the Customer Portal tracking UX so that it clearly represents whether an order has been placed; if no order has been submitted yet in the current session, the Track Order tab must show a clear English message indicating there is no active order to track (instead of implying progress).

Ensure the simulated tracking timers are properly managed in the Customer Portal to prevent memory leaks and state updates after unmount (e.g., navigating away), including clearing any pending timers when a new order is placed and when the page/component unmounts.

Refactor the customer ordering experience to follow a strict step-by-step flow where only one step is visible at a time: Step 1 Restaurant & Menu → Step 2 Cart Page → Step 3 Delivery Details → Step 4 Order Tracking. This flow must be implemented in the existing Customer route (/customer) so that the Home page “Customer Portal” CTA continues to work.

Implement STEP 1: RESTAURANT & MENU view with a single restaurant name and a menu list containing exactly these items and prices: Pizza – 199, Burger – 129, Biryani – 249. Each menu item must have an “Add to Cart” button. After at least one item is added, show a “Go to Cart” button. Do not show cart content, delivery details, or order tracking content in this step.

Implement STEP 2: CART PAGE view to show only the selected food items, with quantity per item and a total price calculation. Provide two buttons: “Continue Shopping” (returns to Step 1) and “Proceed to Details” (advances to Step 3). Do not show menu browsing, delivery form, or tracking status content in this step.

Implement STEP 3: DELIVERY DETAILS view with a form containing fields Name, Phone Number, and Delivery Address, plus a “Place Order” button. Do not show menu or cart content in this step. On successful submission, transition directly to Step 4 and start the tracking progression for the newly placed order.

Implement STEP 4: ORDER TRACKING view that shows order status progression step-by-step in this exact sequence: Order Received → Preparing → Out for Delivery → Delivered. The tracking view must show only the current order status clearly (not a full multi-step timeline).
Ensure smooth navigation between steps and a clear progress flow indicator without violating the “only one step visible at a time” rule.

Update the About Project page copy to match the user-provided text exactly (English), without adding extra claims: “This is a frontend prototype of an Online Food Ordering System developed using a no-code website builder. Backend and database operations are explained conceptually.”
Update the Footer so it includes the exact user-required text in English: “College Mini Project – Online Food Ordering System” and “Thank You”.
Add real dish images for the Customer Portal menu items (Pizza, Burger, Biryani) as static assets and display them in Step 1 (Restaurant & Menu) for each menu card.

Make each dish image in the Customer Portal Step 1 clickable so that clicking opens a dismissible modal displaying a larger version of that dish image, without breaking the existing “Add to Cart” button behavior.

Change the Customer Portal order tracking so it reliably starts fresh for each newly placed order and progresses through the statuses in the correct sequence for the most recent order only: Order Received → Preparing → Out for Delivery → Delivered.

Build Restaurant Portal UI: login, dashboard (new/accepted orders), sample order list (ID/item/status), accept/reject buttons, and menu management list
Build Delivery Partner Portal UI: login, assigned orders list (order ID, pickup restaurant, delivery address) with Picked Up/Delivered buttons
Add About Project section describing frontend no-code implementation and conceptual backend/database workflow
Add Technologies Used section: Frontend (no-code website builder), Backend (conceptual Firebase), Database (conceptual)
Add Footer with: College Mini Project, Online Food Ordering System, Thank You
Add dish images to menu items and make them clickable to open a larger image popup/modal (option 1)
